questions.question_text: Due to a newly announced security advisory, a company has been informed that they must update the configuration of 500 network devices that are deployed in their network. The engineering team must assist the operations team to prepare for this update. The operations team does not have direct access to the network devices and must login via a Linux server. This is the first time that the team is making a network-wide configuration and must change all devices without first installing additional software on the network devices. The operations team is unfamiliar with automation and scripting technologies. Which automation tool must be used to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
yes its C

Selected Answer: C
Only ansible is agentless tool

questions.question_text: An engineer need to implement a solution that prevents loops from occurring accidentally by connecting a switch to interface Ethernet1/1. The port is designated to be used for host connectivity. Which configuration should be implemented?

choices.C: switch# configure terminal switch(config)# interface Ethernet1/1 switch(config-if)# spanning-tree loopguard default
choices.B: switch# configure terminal switch(config)# interface Ethernet1/1 switch(config-if)# spanning-tree guard loop
choices.A: switch# configure terminal switch(config)# interface Ethernet1/1 switch(config-if)# spanning-tree bpduguard enable
choices.D: switch# configure terminal switch(config)# interface Ethernet1/1 switch(config-if)# spanning-tree bpdufilter enable

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
SW9621-1(config)# spanning-tree port type edge bpduguard default

SW9621-1(config)# spanning-tree port type edge bpdufilter default

SW9621-1(config)# spanning-tree port type network default

SW9621-1(config)# spanning-tree vlan 1-3967 priority 24576

Selected Answer: A
LoopGuard is correct

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A.


Loopguard:- The loop guard feature checks if a root port or an alternate root port receives BPDUs. If the port is receiving BPDUs, the loop guard feature puts the port into an inconsistent state until it starts receiving BPDUs again.

Rootguard:- It is enabled on the designated ports of root switch, so that if those ports listen to the superior BPDU then put that port in inconsistent state.

BPDU Guard:-BPDUGuard enables on access port which helps the switches to put the port in shut down mode once it receives the superior BPDU.

BPDU filtering - allows you to avoid transmitting BPDUs on PortFast-enabled ports that are connected to an end system.By default, spanning tree sends BPDUs from all ports regardless of whether PortFast is enabled. BDPU filtering is on a per-switch basis; after you enable BPDU filtering, it applies to all PortFast-enabled ports on the switch.

The correct answer is A:
A) spanning-tree bpduguard enable = cannot receive BPDU
B) spanning-tree guard loop = does not exist 
C) spanning-tree loopguard default = ensure BPDU being receiving 
D) spanning-tree bpdufilter enable = do not receive and send BPDU (the easy way to disable STP into a interface)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/layer2/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Layer_2_Switching_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Layer_2_Switching_Configuration_Guide_chapter_01000.html
A is correct. The configured server interface (fc1/1) needs first to be shutdown before a npv traffic-map can be applied.

choices.A: Shut down fc1/1 in the MDS-EDGE-Switch. Re-apply the command. Enable interface fc1/1.
choices.C: Disable the NPV feature in the MDS-EDGE-Switch. Re-enable the NPV feature. Disable interface fc1/1.
choices.D: Shutdown fc1/3 in the MDS-EDGE-Switch. Re-apply the command. Enable interface fc1/3.
choices.B: Disable the NPIV feature in the MDS-EDGE-Switch. Re-enable the NPIV feature. Disable interface fc1/3.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct!

C is correct:

 Command or Action Purpose
Step 1 
install commit filename

Example:
switch# install commit n9000-dk9.6.1.2.I2.1.CSCab00001.bin
Commits the current set of packages so that these packages are used if the device is restarted.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/system_management/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide/sm_smu.html

choices.A: The switch is restarted after the upgrade is complete.
choices.D: The package is used in the running configuration.
choices.C: The package is used after the switch is restarted.
choices.B: The previous package that was in use is deleted from bootflash.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches for Cisco UCS Director integration. The configuration must enable automated onboarding of the switches as they come online. For security purposes, the switches must have the bare minimum of connection methods enabled. The connection protocol must allow authentication through credentials. Which protocol must be configured on the switches to allow automated onboarding?
